section.name: The sequence filters section of design file
section.p: This section of the design file define the filter that Teolenn must apply on the sequences generated from the genome file.
The following source show the structure of a typical sequence filters section of the design file:
Each sequence filter is defined by:

ul.li: A class if the sequence filter is provided by an external plugin.
Some parameters that allow configure each filter.

section.p: The standard version of Toelenn contains 2 filters:

ul.li: notatgc: filter all the sequence that contains other Nucleic Acid Code that A,T,G or C (case insensitive).
redundancy: filter all the redundancy oligonucleotides.

section.p: Note that this step can be skipped by setting the skip attribute to true.

subsection.name: Use external sequence filters
subsection.p: Teolenn is a very customizable tool, you can use your own sequence filter. This filter must be written in Java and implements the SequenceFilter interface. See the developer section for more information. Your plugin must be in the classpath of Toelenn define in teolenn.sh. In addition, to use your filter in Toelenn, you must add the full name of the main class (witch implements SequenceFilter) of your plugin in the design file :
